resources.string: "You can adjust this setting at any time. Go to Settings > Applications > Video Settings."
"Your device isn't connected to a Wi-Fi network."
" To watch videos, enable Mobile Network for Video in Video Settings."

"Your device isn't connected to a Wi-Fi network, which is required to stream videos.
You can check for available Wi-Fi networks."

"Your device's available Internet bandwidth is too low for uninterrupted streaming. You might experience pauses while the video is buffering. For uninterrupted viewing on a slow connection, we recommend downloading your video in advance. Do you want to continue watching?"
"Your device's available Internet bandwidth is too low for uninterrupted streaming. You might experience pauses while the video is buffering. Do you want to continue watching?"
Your phone is using an experimental Google setting which might cause AIV to stop responding. To fix this, in Settings, tap Developer Options > Select Runtime > Davlik.

"Before you can rent, buy, or watch this title, you must verify your age.
After verification, you can access titles with your Amazon Instant Video PIN."
Enter your 4-digit Amazon PIN to access this restricted title.
Before you can rent, buy, or watch this title, you must set up an Amazon Instant Video PIN.
"We're temporarily unable to verify your PIN. Please try again later."
"FSK 18 titles aren't available when Kindle FreeTime is enabled."
This video is restricted by the Parental Controls you enabled. To change your settings, go to %s.
"We can't resume the video where you stopped watching because not enough of this video has been downloaded. You can:"
"This page can't be loaded. Check your device's network connection, and then try again."

"We're experiencing a problem playing this video.
If this problem continues, please contact Amazon Customer Service."
An error occurred connecting to the network. Please try again.
"There's a problem playing Amazon Instant Video titles. In the Settings for your device, please clear the app's data."
"Your device's clock is incorrect. Connecting your device to the Internet should automatically fix the problem. For more assistance, please contact Amazon Customer Service."
"We've encountered a problem with the HDMI connection. Try reconnecting the HDMI cable. If you connected your HDMI cable to a receiver, try connecting directly to your TV or monitor."
"This video isn't available right now. If this problem continues, please contact Amazon Customer Service and refer to error code 02."
"This video isn't available right now. If this problem continues, please contact Amazon Customer Service and refer to error code 13."
"This video isn't available right now. If this problem continues, please contact Amazon Customer Service and refer to error code 80."
"This video isn't available right now. If this problem continues, please contact Amazon Customer Service and refer to error code 57."
"We've encountered a problem with this video. Please try again. If this problem continues, please contact Amazon Customer Service."
Your device must be online to continue watching this video. Please connect to a Wi-Fi network.
"An Internet connection is required. Please check your device's Internet connection."
A network error occurred. This might be a temporary problem. Please try again in a few minutes. If the problem continues, please contact Amazon Customer Service.
"ENGINEERING BUILD: Can't play past the first 50 MB of the file."
"This page can't be loaded. Please try again."
An error has occurred. Please try again.
Your video has expired. Please connect your device to the Internet for viewing options.
Please disconnect this device from your computer to continue.

"This video can't be streamed on your device because your account is already playing the maximum number of videos on other devices. To watch this video on your device, please stop watching the video on one of your account's other registered devices.
Note: Downloaded videos don't count toward your online viewing limit."
"This video isn't available right now. If this problem continues, please contact Amazon Customer Service."

The maximum number of videos is playing on your account. To watch this video now, stop watching one of the videos playing on your account. It might take 10 minutes before you can begin watching on this device.
"There's a problem playing this video which might be solved automatically by connecting your device to the Internet. If that doesn't solve the problem, delete the video, and then download it again."

"This video was downloaded to another of your registered devices and you have no remaining download licenses.
If this is a rental video, no additional downloads are allowed. If you own this video, you can watch on this device by deleting a downloaded copy from another of your registered devices."
"Your order couldn't be processed due to geographical restrictions. Please refer to the applicable Terms of Use for more details."
"This content can't be accessed due to geographical restrictions. For more details, please refer to the applicable Terms of Use."
To watch this video, please switch to the adult profile that downloaded it.

"You are about to start the %s rental period for this video.
Note: You can download this video to only one device, but you can stream to multiple devices."
You are about to start the %s rental period for this video.
When you start watching the video, it will be available for the next %1$s while your device is offline. To continue watching beyond %2$s, please reconnect your device to the Internet.
The offline viewing period for this video has expired. To watch this video, please reconnect to the Internet.
"An Internet connection is required to complete this task. Please check your device's connection."
An Internet connection is required to complete this task. Please check your connection.
This video is taking longer than expected to load. We recommend checking your network connection or trying again later.
Your favorite videos are available instantly with your mobile network data plan.
• Get more hours of entertainment by increasing your data plan.
• Use the default quality setting to maximize your mobile data plan or use video settings to increase video quality.
Turn on streaming video on a Mobile Network
You are streaming using your mobile data plan.
Go to Video Settings to change your mobile streaming options.
Watch up to 30 minutes of video per 1 GB of your data plan
Watch up to 60 minutes of video per 1 GB of your data plan
Watch up to 120 minutes of video per 1 GB of your data plan
Watch video only when using a Wi-Fi connection
Getting more information from the sponsor…
We were unable to load more information from the sponsor. Your video will play shortly.
Watch the rest of this season for $0.00 with Amazon Prime
Watch now for %1$s with Prime Instant Video
Press and hold to fast forward
"We're unable to display captions for this video."
"Up to 1080p HD when available Longer download times, uses more storage"
720p HD, longer download times, uses more storage
SD, shorter download times, uses less storage
Longer download times, uses more storage
Shorter download times, uses less storage
This item is more than 50 MB and cannot be downloaded when using your mobile data plan. Please connect to a Wi-Fi network to download it.
Your video will download using your mobile data plan.
To continue watching your video using your mobile network data plan, enable Watch Video on Mobile Network in Settings. You can also watch videos when connected to a Wi-Fi network.
